Package org.cpnsim.interscheduler

Class InterSchedulerSimple

java.lang.Object
org.cpnsim.interscheduler.InterSchedulerSimple
All Implemented Interfaces:
DatacenterEntity, Identifiable, Nameable, InterScheduler
Direct Known Subclasses:
InterSchedulerLeastRequested, InterSchedulerRound
public class InterSchedulerSimple extends Object implements InterScheduler
The InterSchedulerSimple class is an implementation of the InterScheduler interface.

The schedule algorithm as follows:

  • scheduleToDatacenter algorithm: Randomly select one of all data centers that may have sufficient resources. If the sum of the remaining resources in all data centers does not meet the resources required by the instance group, the instance group scheduling fails.
  • scheduleToHost algorithm: Randomly select a host from all data centers that may have sufficient resources and start traversing until a suitable host is found. If all hosts are traversed and there is still no suitable one, the scheduling of this instance group fails.
  • scheduleMixed algorithm: It will first try to schedule all instance in the instance group to the hosts in the data center where the inter-scheduler is located. The schedule algorithm is that randomly select a host from all hosts in the data center and start traversing until a suitable host is found. If there is no suitable host in the data center, it will try to forward the instance group to other data centers. The schedule algorithm is that randomly forward the instance group to one of the data centers that may have sufficient resources.
Since:
LGDCloudSim 1.0
Author:
Jiawen Liu

  • Field Details

    • NULL

      public static final int NULL
      The scheduling target of the inter-scheduler. The initial value is NULL, it needs to be set to DC_TARGET, HOST_TARGET, or MIXED_TARGET. You also can set it to other values, but you need to implement the corresponding scheduling algorithm.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DC_TARGET

      public static final int DC_TARGET
      The scheduling target of the inter-scheduler is the data center.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HOST_TARGET

      public static final int HOST_TARGET
      The scheduling target of the inter-scheduler is the host.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MIXED_TARGET

      public static final int MIXED_TARGET
      The scheduling target of the inter-scheduler is the mix of hosts and data centers.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • LOGGER

      public org.slf4j.Logger LOGGER
      The logger of the inter-scheduler.

    • target

      int target
      The target of the inter-scheduler. It can be set to HOST_TARGET, DC_TARGET or MIXED_TARGET.

    • isSupportForward

      boolean isSupportForward
      It is used when the target is DC_TARGET or MIXED_TARGET. It is a flag to set whether the instance group is allowed to be forwarded to other data centers after being sent to the target data center. Note that it is only used when inter-scheduler schedules instance groups to data centers but not schedules the instance of the instance group to hosts.

    • simulation

      Simulation simulation
      The simulation.

    • collaborationId

      int collaborationId
      The collaboration id. It is used for the centralized inter-scheduler of the collaboration zone in CISCloudInformationService.

    • datacenter

      Datacenter datacenter
      The data center where the inter-scheduler is located. If the inter-scheduler is a centralized inter-scheduler of the collaboration zone in CISCloudInformationService, it will not have a data center where it is located.

    • name

      String name
      The name of the inter-scheduler.

    • id

      int id
      The id of the inter-scheduler.

    • instanceGroupQueue

      InstanceGroupQueue instanceGroupQueue
      The instance group queue that stores the new instance groups waiting for scheduling.

    • retryInstanceGroupQueue

      InstanceGroupQueue retryInstanceGroupQueue
      The instance group queue that stores the instance groups that need to be retried for scheduling. When a new round of scheduling starts, the instance group will always be fetched from the retryInstanceGroupQueue first. If the number is not enough, the instance group will be fetched from the general instanceGroupQueue.

    • dcStateSynInterval

      Map<Datacenter,Double> dcStateSynInterval
      The state synchronization interval of each data center.

    • dcStateSynType

      private Map<Datacenter,String> dcStateSynType
      The state synchronization type of each data center.

    • interScheduleSimpleStateMap

      Map<Datacenter,Object> interScheduleSimpleStateMap
      The simple state get from data center by synchronization.

    • random

      Random random
      The random object.

    • scheduleTime

      double scheduleTime
      The time spent on the scheduling.

    • traversalTime

      int traversalTime
      The number of traversals in the schedule

  • Constructor Details

    • InterSchedulerSimple

      public InterSchedulerSimple(int id, Simulation simulation, int collaborationId, int target, boolean isSupportForward)
      The constructor of the InterSchedulerSimple class.
      Parameters:
      id - the id of the inter-scheduler
      simulation - the simulation
      collaborationId - the collaboration zone id
      target - the target of the inter-scheduler, it can be set to HOST_TARGET, DC_TARGET or MIXED_TARGET
      isSupportForward - whether the scheduled instance group by the inter-scheduler supports forward

  • Method Details

    • filterSuitableDatacenterByNetwork

      protected Map<InstanceGroup,List<Datacenter>> filterSuitableDatacenterByNetwork(List<InstanceGroup> instanceGroups)
      Filter to obtain the appropriate data center based on the network constraints of the instance group. It needs to consider the access delay of the instance group, the connection delay between instance groups, and the bandwidth required to be rented between instances.
      Parameters:
      instanceGroups - the instance groups
      Returns:
      the instance group and the list of available data centers

    • schedule

      public InterSchedulerResult schedule()
      Schedule the instance groups. First, it will try to synchronize the state of the data center which is synchronized in real time. Then, it will try to get the instance groups that need to be scheduled from the two instance group queues. In the end, it will try to call the corresponding scheduling algorithm according to the target of the inter-scheduler.
      Specified by:
      schedule in interface InterScheduler
      Returns:
      the result of the inter-scheduler

    • scheduleMixed

      protected InterSchedulerResult scheduleMixed(List<InstanceGroup> instanceGroups)
      It will first try to schedule all instance in the instance group to the hosts in the data center where the inter-scheduler is located. The schedule algorithm is that randomly select a host from all hosts in the data center and start traversing until a suitable host is found. If there is no suitable host in the data center, it will try to forward the instance group to other data centers. The schedule algorithm is that randomly forward the instance group to one of the data centers that may have sufficient resources.
      Parameters:
      instanceGroups - the instance groups to be scheduled
      Returns:
      the result of the inter-scheduler

    • scheduleMixedInstanceGroup

      private Datacenter scheduleMixedInstanceGroup(InstanceGroup instanceGroup, List<Datacenter> availableDatacenters)
      Try to schedule all instance in a instance group to the hosts in the data center where the inter-scheduler is located. If any instance in the instance group is not scheduled successfully, it will try to forward the instance group to other data centers.
      Parameters:
      instanceGroup - the instance group to be scheduled
      availableDatacenters - the available data centers
      Returns:
      the data center where the instance group is scheduled

      availableDatacenters - the available data centers

    • synBetweenDcState

      public void synBetweenDcState(List<Datacenter> datacenters)
      Description copied from interface: InterScheduler
      Get the state synchronization type of each data center. If the synchronization interval to some data centers is 0, it will call this function to get the latest simple state of the data centers. For other data centers whose synchronization period is not 0, it will periodically call this function for synchronization.
      Specified by:
      synBetweenDcState in interface InterScheduler
      Parameters:
      datacenters - the data centers.

      Specified by:
